Module Contents

class payment_simulator.networks.AbstractPaymentNetwork[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

Helper class that provides a standard way to create an ABC using inheritance.

abstract simulate_payments(init_banks: int | None)[source]

Abstract method to simulate payments. This method should be implemented by subclasses.

extract_link_matrix(prop: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Extracts and returns the adjacency matrix of the network graph.

Parameters:

prop (bool, optional) – If True, returns the matrix as proportions of the total transactions. If False, returns raw transaction counts.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray representing the adjacency matrix of the network graph.

Return type:

np.ndarray

_create_transaction()[source]

Creates a transaction between randomly selected banks in the network.

_random_bank(prob) → int[source]

Selects a bank for initiating a transaction based on a weighted probability distribution.

Parameters:

prob (np.ndarray) – Array of probabilities for each bank.

Returns:

The selected bank’s identifier.

Return type:

int

_payment_link(sender: int, receiver: int) → None[source]

Creates or updates a payment link between two banks in the simulation graph.

Parameters:

  • sender (int) – The identifier of the bank initiating the payment.

  • receiver (int) – The identifier of the bank receiving the payment.

class payment_simulator.networks.SimplePaymentNetwork(total_banks: int, avg_payments: int, alpha: float = 0, allow_self_loop: bool = False)[source]

Bases: AbstractPaymentNetwork

Helper class that provides a standard way to create an ABC using inheritance.

simulate_payments(init_banks: int | None = None, increment: int = 2) → None[source]

Simulates the payment processing between banks for a given period, starting with an initial set of banks.

Parameters:

  • init_banks (int, optional) – Initial number of banks to start the simulation with. If None, it defaults to half of the total banks rounded up.

  • increment (int, optional) – The number of banks to add in each iteration.

class payment_simulator.networks.GroupedPaymentNetwork(total_banks: int, bank_groups: list[int | float], avg_payments: int, alpha: float = 0, allow_self_loop: bool = False)[source]

Bases: AbstractPaymentNetwork

Helper class that provides a standard way to create an ABC using inheritance.

simulate_payments(init_banks: int | None = None, increment: int = 2) → None[source]

Simulates the payment processing between banks for a given period, starting with an initial set of banks.

Parameters:

  • init_banks (int, optional) – Initial number of banks to start the simulation with. If None, it defaults to half of the total banks rounded up.

  • increment (int, optional) – The number of banks to add in each iteration.
